plugins.name: Quick Frames
plugins.description:
Quick Frames has a vast library of device frame sizes. Figma defaults are very limited and Figma does not allow users to create and save their own set of device screen resolutions. I just put down a collection so you don't have to google them every time.


Why Quick Frames?

Figma currently lacks built-in support for a comprehensive device frame library.


Why did I build this?

Because I was bored and wanted to build something. I remember sharing a feedback on figma community forum few years ago and its still pending. So decided to make one for it.


Note: This plugin will become useless if Figma decides to support this feature. Till then, enjoy using it.


Reach out to me on Linkedin if you with to connect with me to work on a plugin / share feedback / simply to network üòä

accepted.description: Product Designer with a decade of exp in designing Products, Websites, Design Systems, User research, user interviews etc. I also code for fun.

plugins.name: Vitality AI
plugins.description:
Introducing Vitality AI ‚Äì a Figma plugin revolutionizing design creation! Generate stunning designs effortlessly with just a prompt description. From accordions to sliders, Vitality AI crafts various components to meet your design needs.


Using Vitality AI is a breeze. Simply run the plugin, wait for it to load, then describe your design and click generate. Avoid clicking elsewhere to prevent interference during the design process. Once generated, import your design into Figma with the click of a button. Need inspiration? Hit the randomize button for fresh prompts. Plus, customize import locations using the x and y coordinates.


Note: To use the plugin, users need to create a free Vitality AI account here.


Encounter an error? No worries! The plugin will notify you, or simply restart for a seamless experience. With Vitality AI, design innovation is at your fingertips.


Vitality AI includes the following components:

  1. Accordion
  2. Alert
  3. Avatar
  4. Badge
  5. Button
  6. Calendar NEW
  7. Card
  8. Checkbox
  9. Input
  10. Label
  11. Progress
  12. Radio group
  13. Select
  14. Separator
  15. Skeleton
  16. Slider
  17. Switch
  18. Tabs
  19. Textarea
plugins.tagline: Design with AI, Powered by Your Imagination

plugins.name: EcoSimulateur
plugins.description:
üå± Figma Plugin ‚ÄúEcoSimulateur by Adveris‚Äù: Environmental Analysis from the Design Phase

EcoSimulateur by Adveris is a Figma plugin developed by the agency Adveris to integrate web eco-design principles from the very beginning of a digital project. It enables users to predict the EcoIndex score ‚Äî the reference indicator developed by GreenIT / ecoindex.fr to measure the environmental impact of a web page ‚Äî based on a wireframe or a graphic mockup created in Figma.


üîç Plugin Objective

The goal is simple: provide an estimate of a web page‚Äôs EcoIndex (environmental footprint) before development even starts, helping to guide design decisions towards more sustainable alternatives.


üß† How it Works

The plugin automatically analyzes the structure and graphical content of a Figma mockup, and extrapolates the future EcoIndex score of the final HTML page based on correlations drawn from past real-world web projects.

Specifically, the plugin estimates the three components of the EcoIndex:

  1. DOM Complexity: by analyzing the number and types of layers in the mockup, it estimates the complexity of the expected HTML code.
  2. Number of HTTP Requests: number to be entered by yourself (if new website: default number is GreenIT median / if existing website redesign: enter the current number)
  3. Page Weight: an estimate of the total weight (in KB) of the resources that will be generated from the mockup (based on images/videos area and average weight/px2). In "Options", you can customize weight/px2 and addvideo weight.


üõ†Ô∏è A Decision-Support Tool for Designers

The plugin is preventive and educational: it helps designers spot areas in their mockup that are likely to generate a heavy or complex webpage, and therefore one with a poor environmental performance.

For example:

‚ÄúYour current mockup could result in a page with an EcoIndex score of E. By simplifying some components and reducing resource usage, you could aim for a C or better.‚Äù

This immediate feedback allows adjustments early in the design process, instead of making costly corrections after development.


‚úÖ Key Benefits

  1. Anticipation: predict a site‚Äôs environmental impact before it‚Äôs even coded.
  2. Design Optimization: steer design choices towards more lightweight and efficient solutions.
  3. Seamless Integration: the plugin is directly usable within Figma without disrupting the workflow.
  4. Team Education: raise awareness among designers about eco-design with concrete indicators.


üîó Reference: The EcoIndex from GreenIT.fr

The EcoIndex is an evaluation method developed by the GreenIT.fr collective. It assigns a grade from A (very good) to G (very poor) to a webpage based on three factors:

  1. Page Weight (in KB)
  2. Number of HTTP Requests
  3. DOM Complexity (HTML structure)


These indicators reflect the consumption of digital resources and are translated into estimated environmental impacts (CO‚ÇÇ emissions and water consumption).


üí° In Summary

This "EcoSimulateur" Figma plugin by Adveris is a simple yet powerful tool for embedding eco-design principles into the design process. It turns every mockup into a lever for environmental performance, empowering designers to act right from the earliest stages to create a more sustainable web.
plugins.tagline: Simulate the EcoIndex of your design!

plugins.name: Frame Them All
plugins.description:
In Figma you can add a frame to a single group or frame, but if you have a plenty of groups or frames do add a parent frame you have to do it one by one. This plugin helps you to Frame Them All!

If you have a problem or a suggestion, feel free to open an issue at https://github.com/wildiney/figma-plugin-frame-them-all/issues

plugins.name: Marq
plugins.description:
Introducing Marq - Your Tagging Companion for Figma


Marq is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow and boost productivity. With Marq, you can easily add tags, emojis, and colors to your Figma elements, making organization and collaboration a breeze.


Key Features:

  1. Tagging Made Simple: Marq lets you tag your Figma objects effortlessly. Whether it's marking elements with emojis, text, or both, Marq's intuitive interface makes tagging a breeze.
  2. Rich Emojis Library: Choose from a wide range of emojis to add personality and clarity to your designs.
  3. Color Your Tags: Customize your tags with vibrant colors. Highlight important elements or categorize your designs with a rainbow of options.
  4. Save Presets: Marq allows you to save your favorite tag combinations as presets. No need to recreate the same tags repeatedly; simply apply your saved presets in a click.
  5. Flexible Application: Apply tags and presets to selected objects or the page name, ensuring consistency across your Figma projects.
  6. Real-time Updates: Stay informed with real-time notifications as you tag and apply presets. Marq keeps you in the loop at every step.


Why Marq?

  1. Effortless Organization: Keep your designs tidy and well-structured with clear, visual tags.
  2. Improved Collaboration: Communicate design ideas more effectively with emojis and colors.
  3. Time-Saving Presets: Save time by reusing your favorite tag combinations.
  4. Enhanced Productivity: Streamline your workflow and focus on what matters most‚Äîdesigning.


Say goodbye to cluttered Figma files and hello to a more organized, efficient design process. Try Marq today and elevate your Figma experience!
plugins.tagline: Simplify page and frame management in figma

plugins.name: Figma to Junction
plugins.description:
Globalize Your Designs

Globalize your work through seamless organization. Transfer written content of your designs from Figma into Junction and easily access all translated versions of the text from one location. 


Visual Context

Preview your design for visual context of translations


Get Started:

1. Launch the Plug-in

Click on the plug-in and log in with the demo account. Follow the plug-in instructions to choose a project and transfer your design to Junction.


2. Preview Your Work in Junction

Log in to Junction using the demo account below. You can view your design work in the ‚ÄúScreens‚Äù section under the Figma Demo project.

plugins.name: Figma Layout Fractions
plugins.description:
üìê Figma Layout Fractions


Bring CSS-style fractional layouts into Figma ‚Äî now with full support for px, %, and decimal fr units.


Design responsive layout systems using familiar syntax like:


100px 50% 1fr 2fr

üîß What it does

Apply flexible widths to any selection inside a Frame or Group

Mix px, %, and fr units in any combination

Support for decimal fractions like 0.5fr, 3.25fr, etc.

Automatically rounds widths for clean pixel-perfect layouts

Works across single or multi-row selections



üß™ Real-World Example

Container: 600px

Padding: 10px each side

Gap: 10px between items

Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr


üßÆ Output:


100px (fixed)

300px (50% of full width)

Remaining space split between 1fr and 2fr

53px (1/3 of leftover)

107px (2/3 of leftover)


Perfect for layout prototyping, grids, or creating design systems with math that matches the web.
plugins.tagline: Easily create responsive layouts with CSS-like fractional units in Figma.

126012.name: Figma Layout Fractions
126012.description:
üìê Figma Layout Fractions


Bring CSS-style fractional layouts into Figma ‚Äî now with full support for px, %, and decimal fr units.


Design responsive layout systems using familiar syntax like:


100px 50% 1fr 2fr

üîß What it does

Apply flexible widths to any selection inside a Frame or Group

Mix px, %, and fr units in any combination

Support for decimal fractions like 0.5fr, 3.25fr, etc.

Automatically rounds widths for clean pixel-perfect layouts

Works across single or multi-row selections



üß™ Real-World Example

Container: 600px

Padding: 10px each side

Gap: 10px between items

Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr


üßÆ Output:


100px (fixed)

300px (50% of full width)

Remaining space split between 1fr and 2fr

53px (1/3 of leftover)

107px (2/3 of leftover)


Perfect for layout prototyping, grids, or creating design systems with math that matches the web.
126012.release_notes:
Figma Layout Fractions v1.2 ‚Äî Now with Decimal fr Support!

A small but mighty update to make your fractional layouts even more precise üí•

üöÄ What's New
‚úÖ Decimal fr Units
Use values like 1.5fr, 0.25fr, or 3.75fr to get tighter control over flexible space distribution.

‚úÖ Mixed Units
Combine px, %, and fr all in the same layout string.
Example: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr ‚Äî just like CSS grid.

‚úÖ Pixel-Perfect Rounding
All widths are now rounded to full pixels to avoid subpixel glitches in Figma rendering.

‚úÖ Smarter Percentage Handling
Percentage widths are calculated using the full container width (not leftover space), bringing results in line with how the web and tools like Framer behave.

üß™ Real-World Example
Container: 600px
Padding: 10px each side
Gap: 10px between items
Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr

üßÆ Output:

100px (fixed)
300px (50% of full width)
53px (1/3 of leftover)
107px (2/3 of leftover)
This update brings results closer to what you'd expect from modern responsive layout tools.
126012.tagline: Easily create responsive layouts with CSS-like fractional units in Figma.

  2. [Optimize] team ID form: now you can input both team link or team ID

it may simplify the handoff workflow of designer

plugins.name: Rename Variables, Collections & Styles
plugins.description:
Easily edit variable and collection names without clicking multiple buttons in variable editor


Editing variables in the variables popup dialog is complex, because

  1. You need to double click each name to start editing the name
  2. If you type a variable name that already exists, and press return, you get a error and loose whatever you typed


Renaming any collection needs 3 steps

  1. select collection from dropdown
  2. click open the dot menu
  3. click rename.

This becomes frustrating when you have to rename multiple collections.

accepted.name: Varun
accepted.description: Designer & Developer

plugins.tagline: Easily edit variable and collection names without clicking multiple buttons in variable editor

plugins.name: Dola Project Starter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you, in one click, set up a new project with a good practice pages structure, variables and styles!


Generated styles and variables are based on Tailwind standards which is eliminating the gap between design and development styling primitives and improving the workflow out of the box.


This starter sets up:

  • color variables (primary shades, grays, destructive, border, etc.)
  • spacings variables
  • border radius variables
  • drop shadow effects
  • text styles (like text-2xl/font-bold, etc.)
  • grid styles (base, md, lg, xl, 2xl)
  • pages structure
  • file cover page


And many might be planned, such as:

  • generated style guide based on styles
  • components (buttons, toggles, image ratios, etc)
  • tailwind config export for developers
  • and maybe something else..


So stay tuned, and leave you feedback about what should we improve or add next.


With love,

Dola Service Team ‚ù§Ô∏è

accepted.name: Oleksandr Ploskovytskyy
accepted.description: Software Engineer

plugins.tagline: One-click project starter with Tailwind text, shadow, grid styles and pages structure

plugins.name: SVG with Tokens
plugins.description:
This plugin generates the SVG code you would like to export, but also replaces the static colors values with the original token name. For example, if the SVG would contain: stop-color="#E6EFFA", this plugin will generate instead: stop-color="var(--token-name, #E6EFFA)"


Demo: https://youtu.be/7UYkt4Ym20U
plugins.tagline: Generate the SVG code of any Figma Vector Node, including the color tokens with their default value

plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the repeated naming work of setting variant names!


Henceforth


One click to create a components set,

Reduce the repetition of dozens of keys to two steps.


Instructions for use:

  1. Pre-fill the component variant attribute values you want to create in the plug-inÔºõ
  2. Select a Frame
  3. Click Create to turn the Frame into a set of components made using the property values set in the plug-in, and then you can modify different styles for these variations.


If you have any questions or more functional suggestions and ideas, you can leave a message in the comment area.Looking forward to it.


If it helps you, feel free to buy me a coffee.

plugins.name: Material3 theme generator
plugins.description:
Dynamic Theme Generator for MD3


This feature allows you to create a dynamic theme for Material Design 3 based on your desired color. Using the library provided by MD3, it generates theme data automatically.


How to use:


Click on any Figma node with your desired color to create the theme.

If you prefer, you can input the specific color directly into Figma for precise usage.

With this tool, you can quickly implement dynamic themes in your designs while staying aligned with Material Design 3 principles.


If you have questions or issues.

mail me.


dnay2k@gmail.com

plugins.name: GUI Automation
plugins.description:
This plugin checks your mockup against GUI Automation conventions so the best possible angular project can be generated.


Currently following errors and warnings are supported and recognized:

Naming Convention Error:

For recognizing the correct components they need to be named correctly.

-> Valid Names: 'button', 'checkbox', 'dropdown', 'header', 'image', 'label', 'row', 'select', 'slider', 'tab', 'text field', 'text-field'


Missing Component Error:

Groups of shapes and text should be summarized as a component.


No Auto Layout Warning:

Using auto layout in frames helps produce better placement and overall looks in the generated angular project .
plugins.tagline: This plugin checks your mockup against GUI Automation conventions

plugins.name: ThumbOrg
plugins.description:
ThumbOrg is an intuitive and robust Figma plugin designed to streamline your design process and improve your productivity. It takes the hassle out of manually creating thumbnails for your Figma files and offers a systematic approach to organizing your pages.


Key Features:

  1. Automatic Thumbnail Creation: The plugin auto-generates thumbnails for your Figma files, giving you a visual overview of your designs. Say goodbye to confusion and easily identify each of your files at a glance.
  2. Efficient Page Organization: ThumbOrg allows you to arrange your Figma pages in a clean, logical manner, ensuring a smooth design flow. Maintain a coherent structure for easy navigation and improved understanding of your design system.
  3. User-Friendly Interface: With a simple and intuitive UI, ThumbOrg is a breeze to use. It seamlessly integrates into your Figma workspace, becoming an essential part of your design toolkit.


Experience a new level of convenience and efficiency in your Figma design process with ThumbOrg. It's time to simplify, organize, and visualize your designs like never before.
plugins.tagline: Visual Harmony in Your Design Workflow.

plugins.name: Design Library Showcase Generator by Precocity
plugins.description:
This plugin allows designers to effortlessly create a comprehensive showcase of their design components and all their various permutations within Figma.


Tailored for efficiency and customization, it provides users with some basic settings to adjust the appearance of their showcase page, including background colors, frame spacings, corner radii, and more. With options to show or hide variants, instance properties, and descriptions, this plugin simplifies the process of organizing and presenting your design library to clients, designers, and developers.


Ideal for designers looking to streamline their workflow and present their components in a visually appealing and organized manner without having to manually create each variation, it bridges the gap between design creation and presentation, enhancing both productivity and clarity.

plugins.name: Frame Animator
plugins.description: You'll be able to create several frames with shapes and elements inside, duplicate these frame ( and get an onion skin ( it's a common tool for 2D stop motion animation where you can see the previous shapes in the next frame to easily adjust the new frame based on the positions of the elements of the previous one )). This, to allow you to create 2D animation with a Stop Motion technique.
plugins.tagline: This plugin will allow you to create Stop Motion animations. Onion Skin funcitonnality included.

plugins.name: Simple Task Creator
plugins.description: This plugin allows you to create custom visual frames to organize and represent tasks clearly and effectively. Each task is displayed within a frame that changes color automatically based on the selected task type, enabling quick and easy identification. You can also assign a title and description to each task, providing a detailed view within an attractive and organized visual environment. This plugin is perfect for improving task management and optimizing visual communication in collaborative projects.
plugins.tagline: Create simple tasks selecting between types
